Previous Next

netsquid.components.component

Component related base classes. All components should derive from the Component base class, so that they inherit standard functionality such as ports, subcomponents, and the ability to reset.

class netsquid.components.component.Message(items, **meta_data)

Bases: object

An object used by components to communicate information between ports.

A message object is intended to hold arbitrary information i.e. items could contain quantum or classical information.

Parameters:

  • items (list or object) – Item(s) to be communicated. If object is not a list, it will be stored in one (so that items is always a list).

  • **meta_data – Meta data to be added to the message.

Notes

This object is not intended to model any form of network protocol, or packet, etc. Its purpose is to provide a common and general interface between component communication.

discard_qubits(self)

Discards any qubits held by this message from their quantum states.

The qubit must not have external references.

items

item(s) to be communicated. Intended to be processed by a component e.g. can be lost, have noise applied, etc.

Type:

list

meta

meta data describing the message. Can be used (and abused) as different components see fit.

Type:

dict

class netsquid.components.component.Port(name, component)

Bases: Entity

A message gateway in and out of the component that holds it.

External messages sent to the component are called input, and internal messages that the component sends into the world are called output. For both cases there is an interface to transmit and receive these messages.

Ports can be connected to other ports, in which case one port’s output is passed directly to another port’s input, and vice versa. Ports can also be forwarded, in which case they pass their input or output through to another port.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of this port.

  • component (Component) – Component this port belongs to.

Notes

A port references its component to allow easy crawling of a network through port connection interfaces.

bind_input_handler(self, msg_handler, tag_meta=False)

Set a handler function to call on receiving an input message.

Parameters:

  • msg_handler (func(Message) or None) – Handler function to call on receiving input. Function will be passed a single argument: the message.

  • tag_meta (bool, optional) – Tag the message by adding the name of this port to its meta data using the key rx_port_name.

Raises:

PortBindError – If this port is forwarding its input to another port.

bind_output_handler(self, msg_handler, tag_meta=False)

Set a handler function to call on receiving an output message.

Parameters:

  • msg_handler (func(Message) or None) – Handler function to call. Function will be passed a single argument: the message.

  • tag_meta (bool, optional) – Tag the message by adding the name of this port to its meta data using the key rx_port_name.

Raises:

PortBindError – If this port is connected to or forwarding its output to another port.

component

component this port belongs to.

Type:

Component

connect(self, Port other_port)

Connect output of both ports to each other’s inputs.

It links A.tx_output -> B.tx_input and B.tx_output -> A.tx_input.

Ports should belong to different components. If the components are subcomponents, then both must share the same supercomponent i.e. their ports cannot be connected beyond the confines of their containing composite component. A subcomponent can use port forwarding to communicate via their supercomponent.

Any bound handler functions or output forwarding will be overridden.

Parameters:

other_port (Port) – The port to connect to.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If connecting ports belong to the same component, or if one component is the subcomponent of the other at any level.

  • PortConnectError – If either port is already connected to another port.

Notes

This function is symmetric i.e. port1.connect(port2) does the same as port2.connect(port1).

connected_port

the port this port is connected to.

Type:

Port or None

disconnect(self)

Disconnect the connected or forwarded output of this port.

Will disconnect two ports if they are connected. Will remove forwarding if this is the output forwarding port. Does nothing if this port is receiving forwarded output.

forward_input(self, Port other_port)

Forward input to input of another port.

It links A.tx_input -> B.tx_input.

Can only forward input to ports of subcomponents of the component of this Port, or between ports of the same component. Any bound handler function and input_port will be overridden.

Parameters:

other_port (Port or None) – Port to forward input to. If None and this port was forwarding its input, then this Port stops forwarding.

Raises:

ValueError – If forwarding ports does not belong to a subcomponent.

Notes

This function is asymmetric i.e. port1.forward_input(port2) is different to port2.forward_input(port1).

If the port is already forwarding, then this will be overwritten.

forward_output(self, Port other_port)

Forward output to output of another port.

It links A.tx_output -> B.tx_output.

Can only forward output to ports of the supercomponent of the component of this Port, or between ports of the same component. Any bound handler function and output ports will be overridden.

Parameters:

other_port (Port or None) – Port to forward output to. If None and this port was forwarding its output, then this Port stops forwarding.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If forwarding ports does not belong to the supercomponent

  • PortForwardError – If this port is already connected to another port.

Notes

This function is asymmetric i.e. port1.forward_output(port2) is different to port2.forward_output(port1).

If the port is already forwarding, then this will be overwritten.

forwarded_ports

containing Ports with the keys ‘output’ or ‘input’ if either is being forwarded, otherwise empty.

Type:

dict

input_queue

list of input (event, message) tuples waiting on this port, sorted on time (oldest first).

Type:

list

is_connected

whether this port has its output connected to another port.

Type:

bool

name

name of this port.

Type:

str

notify_all_input

whether to always schedule an input event when this port is connected, forwarded, or bound. Default is False.

Type:

bool

notify_all_output

whether to always schedule an output event when this port is connected, forwarded, or bound. Default is False.

Type:

bool

notify_next_input

whether to schedule an event on next input message also when this port is connected, forwarded, or bound. Default is False.

Type:

bool

notify_next_output

whether to schedule an event on next output message also when this port is connected, forwarded, or bound. Default is False.

Type:

bool

output_queue

list of output (event, message) tuples waiting on this port, sorted on time (oldest first).

Type:

list

query_meta_input(self, **meta_filters)

Check if a message with specified meta data was input at this instant.

Also the meta of messages that are passed through the port are logged.

Parameters:

**meta_filters – The filters for which to check if a message came through, based on their meta data.

Returns:

True if meta filters match the meta of messages that have passed through the port, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

query_meta_output(self, **meta_filters)

Check if a message with specified meta data passed through the output at this instant.

Also the meta of messages that are passed through the port are logged.

Parameters:

**meta_filters – The filters for which to check if a message came through, based on their meta data.

Returns:

True if meta filters match the meta of messages that have passed through the port, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

remove(self)

Removes the entity from the simulation.

reset(self)

Reset this port.

Clears all stored messages and restarts any set callback handlers.

Should be called after a simulation reset.

rx_input(self, Event event=None, **meta_filters)

Receive an input message sent by the outside world to the component.

A message must be received at the same instant it was transmitted, otherwise it is lost.

Parameters:

  • event (Event or None, optional) – The specific transmission event.

  • **meta_filters – Keyword arguments to filter the input messages based on their meta data.

Returns:

The transmitted message or None if there is no received message.

Return type:

Message or None

rx_output(self, Event event=None, **meta_filters)

Receive an output message sent by the component to the outside world.

A message must be received at the same instant it was transmitted, otherwise it is lost.

Parameters:

  • event (Event or None, optional) – The specific transmission event.

  • **meta_filters – Keyword arguments to filter the output messages based on their meta data.

Returns:

The transmitted message or None if there is no received message.

Return type:

Message or None

tx_input(self, message)

Transmit an input message to the component from the outside world.

This is used to send an external message from the outside world to the component that owns this port.

If this port is not forwarded or have a bound handler, then the message is stored on this port and will schedule an input event of type evtype_input.

Parameters:

message (Message or object) – Message to input via this port. If not of type Message, it will be converted to this type.

Notes

If multiple messages are transmitted at the same instant, they will keep a FIFO order.

tx_output(self, message)

Transmit an output message to the outside world from the component.

If this port is connected to another port, the message is passed through, and an input event will be scheduled on the other port.

If this port is not forwarded, connected, or have a bound handler, then the message is stored on this port and will schedule an output event of type evtype_output.

Parameters:

message (Message or object) – Message to output via this port. If not of type Message, it will be wrapped as this type.

Notes

If multiple messages are transmitted at the same instant, they will keep a FIFO order.

uid

returns a unique identifier for this entity in the simulation.

Each entity has a unique identifier in the simulation.

Type:

int

class netsquid.components.component.Component(name, properties=None, models=None, subcomponents=None, port_names=None)

Bases: Entity

Base class for a general component.

Components represent physical network components or combinations thereof i.e. components can also be composite objects that hold subcomponents.

Components use Ports both to interface with the external world and with parent or child components.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of component for identification and display purposes.

  • properties (dict or None, optional) – Properties associated with this component, as key-value pairs. Properties set this way are mutable and do not have a specified type.

  • models (dict or None, optional) – Models associated with this component. Will first specify them by their type and them set them. See the Models section of a component to see which (key, Model) pair it recognizes.

  • subcomponents (dict or None, optional) – Sub-components of this component.

  • port_names (list of str or None, optional) – Names of ports to add to this component.

Properties:

*Describe any* :attr:`~netsquid.components.component.Component.properties` *here*.

Ports:

*Describe any* :attr:`~netsquid.components.component.Component.ports` *here*.

Models:

*Describe any* :attr:`~netsquid.components.component.Component.models` *here*.

Subcomponents:

*Describe any* :attr:`~netsquid.components.component.Component.subcomponents` *here*.

add_ports(self, names)

Add ports to this component.

Added ports are accessible via ports.

Parameters:

names (list of str) – Names of ports.

Returns:

List of the ports with the given names.

Return type:

list of Port

Notes

If a port with this name already exists it is also returned in the list, but not overwritten.

add_property(self, name, value=None, mutable=True, value_type=None, value_constraints=None)

Add a property to this component.

Properties can be accessed and modified via the properties attribute.

If a property with this name already exists, an attempt will be made to set the new value.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the property.

  • value (Any) – Value of the property.

  • mutable (bool, optional) – Whether the property is mutable.

  • value_type (type, optional) – Type of this property

  • value_constraints (~netsquid.util.constrainedmap.ValueConstraint or list of ~netsquid.util.constrainedmap.ValueConstraint , optional) – constraint checks to verify if value is a valid value

add_subcomponent(self, component, name=None, forward_input=None, forward_output=None, add_ports=False)

Add a subcomponent to this component.

Subcomponents can be accessed using the subcomponents property.

If a component already exists with this name identifier it will be replaced.

Parameters:

  • component (Component) – Component to add.

  • name (str or None, optional) – Custom name identifier for component. If None (default), the name of the component being added is used. If a component using the same name already exists it is overridden.

  • forward_input (list of tuple of str or None, optional) – Names of ports to forward input from parent component to subcomponent. Each tuple in this list consist of two port names: The first port name is the port of the parentcomponent. The second port name is the port of the subcomponent.

  • forward_output (list of tuple of str or None, optional) – Names of ports to forward output from subcomponent to parent component. Each tuple in this list consist of two port names: The first port name is the port of the parentcomponent. The second port name is the port of the subcomponent.

  • add_ports (bool, optional) – If ports should be created if they do not yet exist. Default False

Raises:

ComponentHierarchyError – If the component to be added is already related to this component as a sub or super component at any depth. Or if the component is already a subcomponent of an other component.

Example

Instead of

>>> from netsquid.components import Component
...
>>> parent = Component("parent", port_names=["in_p", "out_p"])
>>> child = Component("child", port_names=["in_c", "out_c"])
>>> parent.add_subcomponent(child)
>>> parent.ports["in_p"].forward_input(child.ports["in_c"])
>>> child.ports["out_c"].forward_output(parent.ports["out_p"])

One can do

>>> parent = Component("parent", port_names=["in_p", "out_p"])
>>> child = Component("child", port_names=["in_c", "out_c"])
>>> parent.add_subcomponent(child,
...     forward_input=[("in_p", "in_c")],
...     forward_output=[("out_p", "out_c")])
has_subcomponent(self, component)

Whether argument is a subcomponent of this component at any level.

Returns:

True if component contained as a subcomponent at any level, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

has_supercomponent(self, component)

Whether argument is a supercomponent of this component at any level.

models

the models associated with this component.

Models that a component can hold are strictly define at construction. To change the model use: models[name_model] = model().

Type:

ConstrainedMap

name

Name of component for identification and display purposes.

Type:

str

ports

ports belonging to this component.

Type:

ConstrainedMap

properties

the properties associated with this component.

Type:

ConstrainedMap

rem_subcomponent(self, name)

Remove a subcomponent from this component.

Outgoing port connections are disconnected to keep the hierarchy consistent; That means that any port connections to the parent or siblings are disconnected. Input ports to subcomponents remain.

Parameters:

name (str) – Name identifier for component.

remove(self)

Removes the entity from the simulation.

reset(self)

Reset the component.

Will reset all of its ports and (sub)components.

specify_model(self, name, model_type=None)

Specify the model types needed by this component.

Models that are not first specified cannot be set. To set a model do Component.models[name_model] = model.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Key of item.

  • model_type (~netsquid.components.models.Model) – Type of model. If None, ~netsquid.components.models.Model base class is set.

Raises:

KeyError – If a model with name has already been specified.

subcomponents

Return list of subcomponents of this component and their identifiers.

Returns:

Subcomponents of this component.

Return type:

ConstrainedMap

supercomponent

parent component, if any.

Type:

Component or None

uid

returns a unique identifier for this entity in the simulation.

Each entity has a unique identifier in the simulation.

Type:

int

exception netsquid.components.component.ComponentError

Bases: Exception

Error associated with components.

with_traceback()

Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

exception netsquid.components.component.ComponentHierarchyError

Bases: ComponentError

Error related to an incorrect hierarchy of components

Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

Bases: PortError

Bases: PortError
